1.text: Then shall the kingdom of heaven be likened unto ten virgins, which took their lamps, and went forth to meet the bridegroom.

2.text: And five of them were foolish, and five were wise.

3.text: For the foolish, when they took their lamps, took no oil with them:

4.text: but the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps.

5.text: Now while the bridegroom tarried, they all slumbered and slept.

6.text: But at midnight there is a cry, Behold, the bridegroom! Come ye forth to meet him.

7.text: Then all those virgins arose, and trimmed their lamps.

8.text: And the foolish said unto the wise, Give us of your oil; for our lamps are going out.

9.text: But the wise answered, saying, Peradventure there will not be enough for us and you: go ye rather to them that sell, and buy for yourselves.

10.text: And while they went away to buy, the bridegroom came; and they that were ready went in with him to the marriage feast: and the door was shut.

11.text: Afterward come also the other virgins, saying, Lord, Lord, open to us.

12.text: But he answered and said, Verily I say unto you, I know you not.

13.text: Watch therefore, for ye know not the day nor the hour.

14.text: For it is as when a man, going into another country, called his own servants, and delivered unto them his goods.

15.text: And unto one he gave five talents, to another two, to another one; to each according to his several ability; and he went on his journey.

16.text: Straightway he that received the five talents went and traded with them, and made other five talents.

17.text: In like manner he also that received the two gained other two.

18.text: But he that received the one went away and digged in the earth, and hid his lordâ€™s money.

19.text: Now after a long time the lord of those servants cometh, and maketh a reckoning with them.

20.text: And he that received the five talents came and brought other five talents, saying, Lord, thou deliveredst unto me five talents: lo, I have gained other five talents.

21.text: His lord said unto him, Well done, good and faithful servant: thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will set thee over many things: enter thou into the joy of thy lord.

22.text: And he also that received the two talents came and said, Lord, thou deliveredst unto me two talents: lo, I have gained other two talents.

23.text: His lord said unto him, Well done, good and faithful servant; thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will set thee over many things: enter thou into the joy of thy lord.

24.text: And he also that had received the one talent came and said, Lord, I knew thee that thou art a hard man, reaping where thou didst not sow, and gathering where thou didst not scatter:

25.text: and I was afraid, and went away and hid thy talent in the earth: lo, thou hast thine own.

26.text: But his lord answered and said unto him, Thou wicked and slothful servant, thou knewest that I reap where I sowed not, and gather where I did not scatter;

27.text: thou oughtest therefore to have put my money to the bankers, and at my coming I should have received back mine own with interest.

28.text: Take ye away therefore the talent from him, and give it unto him that hath the ten talents.

29.text: For unto every one that hath shall be given, and he shall have abundance: but from him that hath not, even that which he hath shall be taken away.

30.text: And cast ye out the unprofitable servant into the outer darkness: there shall be the weeping and gnashing of teeth.

31.text: But when the Son of man shall come in his glory, and all the angels with him, then shall he sit on the throne of his glory:

32.text: and before him shall be gathered all the nations: and he shall separate them one from another, as the shepherd separateth the sheep from the goats:

33.text: and he shall set the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left.

34.text: Then shall the King say unto them on his right hand, Come, ye blessed of my Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world:

35.text: for I was an hungred, and ye gave me meat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me drink: I was a stranger, and ye took me in;

36.text: naked, and ye clothed me: I was sick, and ye visited me: I was in prison, and ye came unto me.

37.text: Then shall the righteous answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungred, and fed thee? or athirst, and gave thee drink?

38.text: And when saw we thee a stranger, and took thee in? or naked, and clothed thee?

39.text: And when saw we thee sick, or in prison, and came unto thee?

40.text: And the King shall answer and say unto them, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye did it unto one of these my brethren, even these least, ye did it unto me.

41.text: Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into the eternal fire which is prepared for the devil and his angels:

42.text: for I was an hungred, and ye gave me no meat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me no drink:

43.text: I was a stranger, and ye took me not in; naked, and ye clothed me not; sick, and in prison, and ye visited me not.

44.text: Then shall they also answer, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungred, or athirst, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and did not minister unto thee?

45.text: Then shall he answer them, saying, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye did it not unto one of these least, ye did it not unto me.

46.text: And these shall go away into eternal punishment: but the righteous into eternal life.
